name: Hash Table Operations
explanation: Hash tables store key-value pairs using a hash function to map keys to array indices. Provides O(1) average-case performance for insert, search, and delete operations. Hash function should distribute keys uniformly. Collision handling (chaining or open addressing) needed when multiple keys hash to same index. Used in databases, caches, and when fast lookups are critical.

examples.problem: Hash function h(x) = x mod 10. Insert keys [15, 23, 7, 31]
Why is hash table lookup O(1) on average?
examples.solution: Hash function directly computes array index, no searching needed
steps: Average case: no collisions, direct access
Worst case: many collisions, O(n) if all keys hash to same index
